summary: This is an email from June 28, 2019, discussing the need for a deputy chief to sign off on Jeffrey Epstein's first indictment draft. The sender notes that front office approval has been obtained but a deputy chief's signature is still required, and suggests sending the indictment and prosecution memo for signature that day. An attachment is referenced: a draft indictment dated June 25, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment draft being discussed; referred to by initials 'JE' in the attachment filename.

events.title: Draft of First Indictment Against Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein is prepared and attached to the email.

events.title: Email Discussion on Indictment Sign-off
events.description: Email correspondence discusses the procedural step of obtaining a deputy chief's signature on the Epstein indictment, noting front office approval is already secured.

keyFacts: A draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein was prepared by June 25, 2019.
By June 28, 2019, the indictment had received sign-off from front office personnel but still required a deputy chief's signature.
The email suggests urgency in obtaining the signature, noting many deputy chiefs may be out the following week.
The correspondence indicates internal DOJ procedural steps for finalizing the Epstein indictment.
